channel.title: Posts on dfl.ddns.net v3
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on dfl.ddns.net v3

item.title: Labour's Rules
item.description:
Meta

This is a simple mirror of https://davelevy.info/wiki/labours-rule-book/ , that page has a bitly alias https://bit.ly/labourrules and contains documents other than the rules.

Here’s the 2024 rule book [http/pdf], and my mirror copy. These are the rules as passed by #LAB24.

The Archive

Here are my copies of the old rules, I posted some of them to the wikipedia, but they decided that they lacked significance because they weren’t cited enough, so wikipedia considers this to be original research

item.title: Sun Solaris
item.description:
Solaris 10 & 11

Pre-Oracle takeover binaries for Solaris are hard to come by it seems, I have posted sol-10-u6-ga1-x86-dvd.iso (https) which I found on my hard disk and also as a torrent, sol-10-u6-ga1-x86.torrent, this should be Solaris 10, Update 6 for x86.

  1. sol-10-u6-ga1-x86-dvd.iso (https 2.15 Gb)
  2. sol-10-u6-ga1-x86.torrent (.torrent)
  3. Solaris 11 (https .tgz 2.39 Gb) … needs a torrent
  4. Solaris 11 Developer Tools … Netbeans & Sun Studio (https .tgz)
  5. Sun SDD Tool (https .tgz) i.e. the Sun Device Detection Tool
  6. Solaris 11 Licence (https .pdf)
  7. Open Solaris 2009.06 (Internet Archive https) … I think I can make a torrent for this too.

item.title: Labour's Forde Report
item.description:
The Forde Report

The Forde Report is the culmination of an independent investigation commissioned by the Labour Party’s National Executive Committee (NEC) in 2020 to investigate both the contents of an internal report leaked into the public domain, as well as the circumstances in which it was prepared and put into the public domain.

  1. The Forde Report 18.7.2022 (https .pdf)
  2. The Forde Report 18.7.2022 (html wayback machine)
  3. The Forde Report (.torrent)

The Labour Party published its action plan on the Forde Reporti, and I have collected some assets which are available,

item.title: WOTC's OGL
item.description:
Dungeons & Dragons

The game is owned by a public company and has published its rules under a permissive copyleft licence. Here are the key ‘open’ artefacts.

  1. The Player’s handbook ( .pdf wayback machine) and my .pdf mirror
  2. The Player’s handbook (.torrent)
  3. The OGL 1.0a & SRD 5.1 (.pdf wizards) and my .pdf mirror
  4. The OGL & SRD 5.1 (.torrent)
  5. DnD Beyond’s SRD 5.2 landing page and my mirror of SRD 5.2

See also a resource index on my wiki in an article that tried to track the whole scandal. In short, WOTC backed down.
